entry.title: Information Overload 2010-10-17
entry.content:
• "The 'Irrational' Way Humans Interact With Dentists":http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=130356647
    Are our relationships with our dentists a form of the "Stockholm Syndrome":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stockholm_syndrome? Ask the behavioral psychologist.
  • "RCA student radically improves the UK plug":http://www.iconeye.com/index.php?id=3864:rca-student-radically-improves-the-uk-plug&option=com_content&view=article
    Awesome redesign of an everyday item.
  • "William Gibson says the future is right here, right now":http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-11502715
    When it comes to the future, who to trust if not William Gibson?
  • "What a scientist didn't tell the New York Times about his study on bee deaths":http://money.cnn.com/2010/10/08/news/honey_bees_ny_times.fortune/index.htm
    Follow-up to last week's NYT article on "Colony Collapse Disorder":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colony_collapse_disorder. How is "Bayer":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayer related to all of this?
  • "Die kritische Masse":http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/0,1518,722673,00.html
    Interesting article on online review portals, user motivation and manipulation (in German).
  • "Whistleblower reveals 'systematic' humiliation of detainees":http://www.rawstory.com/rs/2010/10/whistleblower-reveals-systematic-humiliation/
    When reading things like this, "what goes around comes around" is always my first sad thought.
  • "The Numbers Game":http://structureofnews.wordpress.com/2010/10/12/the-numbers-game/
    A plea to increase "numeracy":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Numeracy amongst journalists. Amen to that!
  • "Sweden joins Europe-wide backlash against immigration":http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2010/sep/24/sweden-immigration-far-right-asylum
    Sweden joins the ranks of European countries where xeno- and Islamophobia win elections. Also contains a short summary of similar developments all over Europe.
  • "Irish ISP wins major legal victory against record labels":http://www.techeye.net/internet/irish-isp-wins-major-legal-victory-against-record-labels
    UPC wins a court case against the record industry and does not have to implement a three strikes system for its customers (for now).
  • "Council of Europe Agrees That Net neutrality is Key to Freedom of Expression":http://www.laquadrature.net/en/council-of-europe-agrees-that-net-neutrality-is-key-to-freedom-of-expression
    Some more good news on the freedom of expression front.
